title: Which one is correct? “Was it hard to get used to it?” or “Was it hard to got used to it?” Should I use the past tense after “was” in this case or not? - Quora

response.answer_text: The correct choice would be “Was it hard to get used to it? or better stated “Was it hard getting accustomed to it?” Generally, when dealing with a question I prefer to translate it to a statement. … makes things easier that way. So you have, “It was hard getting used to it. From this little change in wording you can see that getting used to it must be present tense. (You would never say Gotting used to it so, it follows that you also would not say “… hard to got used to it.” ) In the sentence, It was hard to get used to it, the word, was, means that the getting used to it happened in the past. But, in the past when the getting used to something was happening, at that moment it was happening in present time. Also note the words, to get, which is the infinitive form of the word, get. The infinitive form which is used for definitions can only be in present tense, never in past tense. The word, to, must always be followed by a present tense verb.

To Przemek Zarobnik, “Was it hard to get used to it?” is correct, because the infinitive is formed by “to” plus the base form of the verb, not the past tense. Therefore “Was it hard to got used to it?” is incorrect. The use of “was” is correct. —Sarah M., posted 16 April 2019  QUESTION: Which one is correct? “Was it hard to get used to it?” or “Was it hard to got used to it?” Should I use the past tense after “was” in this case or not?
